description: How AI Impacts Small & Solo Firms: Exploring the Potential Benefits & Risks of Incorporating AI Into Practice

Small and solo law firms are increasingly adopting artificial intelligence (AI) to improve efficiency. Thomas Shack, a former Comptroller of Massachusetts, offers a program to explain AI's role in modern legal practice. The session covers AI applications like legal research, document review, and predictive analytics, emphasizing the importance of responsible use to avoid errors. Leveraging AI can keep firms competitive if used wisely.
From Billable Hours to Sustainable Income: The Power of Subscription Models + AI

Artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping how legal services are provided. Join Mathew Kerbis, known as The Subscription Attorney, in this course as he delves into the fusion of AI and the subscription model to revolutionize your law practice. Kerbis provides actionable insights into incorporating AI, such as prompt engineering methods, and explores how AI can democratize legal services. He suggests a shift away from the billable hour, highlighting the competitive edge and enhanced profitability that comes with integrating subscription models and AI technologies.

description: The Attack on DEI – Safeguarding Corporate DEI Initiatives Post-Supreme Court’s Affirmative Action Decision

This webinar offered an exploration of the historical context surrounding challenges to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), including the Supreme Court's recent ruling on Students for Fair Admissions (SFFA). It also delved into reactions from conservative organizations and provides practical guidance for companies seeking to safeguard their DEI initiatives in the aftermath of the Supreme Court's decision.
